DataFrame_0.Name: Azure DevOps Services
DataFrame_0.Associated collaborative development env: Azure DevOps Services Microsoft Visual Studio
DataFrame_0.Notes: Most features are free for open source projects or teams of 5 members or less[2]

DataFrame_0.Name: Bitbucket
DataFrame_0.Associated collaborative development env: Atlassian BitBucket Server, JIRA and Confluence
DataFrame_0.Notes: Denies service to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria[3]

DataFrame_0.Name: Gitea
DataFrame_0.Notes: Gitea is an open-source software tool funded on Open Collective that is designed for self-hosting, but also provides a free first-party instance.

DataFrame_0.Name: GForge
DataFrame_0.Associated collaborative development env: Cloud version – free up to 5 users. On-premises version – free up to 5 users.
DataFrame_0.Notes: GForge is free for open source projects.

DataFrame_0.Name: GitHub
DataFrame_0.Developer: GitHub, Inc. (A subsidiary of Microsoft Corporation)
DataFrame_0.Notes: Denies service to Crimea, North Korea, Sudan, Syria[7] List of government takedown requests

DataFrame_0.Name: GitLab
DataFrame_0.Associated collaborative development env: GitLab FOSS – free software GitLab Enterprise Edition (EE) – proprietary
DataFrame_0.Notes: Denies service to Crimea, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria[11]

DataFrame_0.Name: GNU Savannah
DataFrame_0.Notes: For use by projects with GPL compatible licenses, subject to staff approval. Code access review.[12]

DataFrame_0.Name: Helix TeamHub
DataFrame_0.Associated collaborative development env: Cloud version – free up to 5 users. On-premises version requires a license.
DataFrame_0.Notes: Free cloud version has no limits on projects within 5gb storage limit. On-premises version has DevOps pipeline technology and free replicas.

DataFrame_0.Name: Launchpad
DataFrame_0.Notes: Supports Bazaar and Git for version-controlled repository hosting.[13][14]

DataFrame_0.Name: Ourproject.org
DataFrame_0.Notes: For free software, free culture and free content projects.

DataFrame_0.Name: SourceForge
DataFrame_0.Notes: For use by open-source projects.[19] Ad-supported. Subject to American export restrictions, so denies service to Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, Syria.[20]

DataFrame_1.Name: Helix TeamHub
DataFrame_1.Build system: Yes, with hooks. Jenkins, TeamCity, etc.

DataFrame_4.Name: freedesktop.org
DataFrame_4.Notes: Only for interoperability and shared base technology for free software desktop environments on Linux and other Unix-like operating systems, including the X Window System (X11) and cairo (graphics).

DataFrame_4.Name: mozdev.org
DataFrame_4.Notes: Only for Mozilla-related projects. Defunct as of July 2020.
